rules.trigger: Whenever you arrive at a new location in the mundane world,
rules.outro: decide whether you have been here before, and if so, name some detail about the place significant to you. Also, decide if you met someone there and what you left behind. The GM will say what has changed since then.

options.name: Options
items: I know something about this (ask the GM what you know and take #>text-keyword>+1 ongoing<# while acting on the answers during this scene).
I know where I can find more information about this (ask the GM where).

rules.trigger: Upon coming in contact with a magical discipline, entity, or phenomenon for the first time,

completeSuccess.result: Take both options below.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below.

failure.result: You have a hazy memory of something like this, but can't say for sure if it's true or not. The GM explains what it is you remember.

rules.intro: #>text-center>You are a student of the occult.<#

rules.trigger: When you refuse to give in even if the odds turn against you,
rules.outro: mark 1 Time to reroll the dice.

questions.name: Questions
items: What are you afraid of?
What is precious to you?

rules.intro: Whenever you #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Read a Person':data-action='open'>Read a Person<#, you may choose from these questions in addition to the usual ones:

options.name: Options
items: Placate someone who is becoming suspicious.
Get access to a place outsiders aren't allowed to go.
Get someone to tell you about this place's secrets.
Get someone's assistance with something here.

rules.trigger: Whenever you try to blend into a place or crowd by adapting your appearance and behavior to the others present,

completeSuccess.result: Choose three options from the list below. You may save up to two for later.

partialSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below. You may save one for later.

failure.result: Choose one option from the list below, but things don't go according to plan. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.trigger: Whenever you take risks or make sacrifices for your code of honor,

rules.intro: You abide by a strict code of honor. Decide its nature when you take this Advantage.

options.name: Options
items: Find or create a map of the location.
Uncover any security systems and other obstacles.
Pinpoint the location of something you're after.

rules.trigger: Whenever you investigate a location prior to visiting it,
rules.holdText: The GM can spend Hold at any time to make a hard or soft Move for the location.

completeSuccess.result: Choose three options from the list below.

partialSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below.

failure.result: Choose one option from the list below, but you have missed or overlooked something crucial: #>text-gmtext>The GM takes 1 Hold<#.

rules.holdText: The GM can spend Hold at any time to make a hard or soft Move for the location.

rules.trigger: Whenever you help another at your own expense,

powers.name: Powers
items: Configure your artifact's powers with the help of the GM.

examplepowers.name: Example Powers
items: See the true form of a creature or location.
Receive a vision of what threatens you.
Get yourself out of a bind.
Call on the entity bound to the artifact and bargain with them.

rules.trigger: Whenever you activate the object,

completeSuccess.result: Choose one power to invoke from the list below (the GM determines what happens).

partialSuccess.result: Choose one power to invoke from the list below (the GM determines what happens). However, the artifact also exacts an additional price (the GM determines what is required).

failure.result: The artifact does something unexpected, possibly dangerous. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: You own a seemingly mundane item, which actually possesses mystical powers.%insert.break%Its powers can be activated through certain methods, such as infusing it with blood or whispering forbidden words (you decide what is required).%insert.break%Work with the GM to devise a list of options appropriate to the artifact, using this list as an example: %list.examplepowers%

options.name: Options
items: Act first in a threatening situation. This can include even acting prior to a surprise attack.
Sense whether someone wishes good or ill towards you.
Discover or sense a clue or lead when you're off track.

rules.trigger: At the start of each game session,

completeSuccess.result: Choose three options from the list below, useable any time during the session.

partialSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below, useable any time during the session.

failure.result: Your instincts will fail to trigger in a dangerous situation. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<# at some point during the session.

rules.intro: #>text-center>You have an intuition for things, both good and bad.<#

options.name: Options
items: The mole has penetrated the organization's inner circle; however, their influence is limited.
The mole owes you one; however, you must meet their demands to get what you want.

rules.trigger: Whenever you make contact with one of your moles to acquire info or services,
rules.outro: explain what group or organization the mole belongs to, name them, and then %insert.rollPrompt%.

completeSuccess.result: You receive both options below.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one of the options below.

failure.result: The mole's loyalties are questionable. Can you trust them? #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: You have placed a number of moles in groups or organizations of interest to you, such as business competitors, governments, or cults.

rules.trigger: Whenever you need money, a safehouse, protection, or other help one of your victims can provide,

completeSuccess.result: They can provide you with whatever you require.

partialSuccess.result: One of them might be able to help, but it will take some convincing.

failure.result: You know someone who can help, but they have already seen through your game. If you want their assistance it will require threats or blackmail to get them to provide it.

rules.intro: You maintain relationships with numerous people who all believe you are their soulmate, yet are unaware of each other.

rules.trigger: Whenever you try to make it through overwhelming odds,
rules.outro: take #>text-keyword>+1 ongoing<# on all rolls until you're clear of the threat.

rules.trigger: Whenever you make a show of being the boss,

completeSuccess.result: People around you accept you as their leader and listen to you. Take #>text-keyword>+1 ongoing<# against people in this scene.

partialSuccess.result: People feel you're leadership material and show you respect. Choose one of them, in particular, who goes along with what you think. You have #>text-keyword>+1 ongoing<# against them during this scene.

failure.result: People feel like you're the leader, but one of them tries to challenge you for it. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

watchers.name: Watchers Gang
items: Small Gang: #>text-keyword>2 Harm<#, #>text-keyword>5 Wounds<#
Medium Gang: #>text-keyword>3 Harm<#, #>text-keyword>10 Wounds<#
Large Gang: #>text-keyword>3 Harm<#, #>text-keyword>15 Wounds<#
watchers.intro: The GM determines the size of the gang that appears, based on the power of the threat you face.

rules.trigger: Whenever you are in mortal danger and choose to activate your Watchers,
rules.outro: #>text-gmtext>the GM takes 1 Hold<# and introduces your Watchers to the scene. Their sole motivation is to keep you out of harm's reach.
rules.holdText: The GM can spend Hold on the Watchers' behalf to let them make a Move against you.

rules.intro: You are being watched over and protected by a group of mysterious people who intend on keeping you alive for their own obscure purposes.
rules.holdText: The GM can spend Hold on the Watchers' behalf to let them make a Move against you.

rules.trigger: When it would be useful to know someone at a university,
rules.outro: provide the person's name, field of study, and how you got to know one another, then %insert.rollPrompt%.

completeSuccess.result: The person is a friend (#>text-keyword>Relation +1<#).

partialSuccess.result: The person is an acquaintance (#>text-keyword>Relation +0<#).

failure.result: You know one another, but there is an old enmity between the two of you (#>text-keyword>Relation +0<#).

rules.intro: You have academic contacts at universities around the world.

rules.trigger: Whenever you experiment on a human and wish to implant an order into them,

completeSuccess.result: You hold 2 Power over them. For as long as you retain Power over them, they take 1 #>text-keyword>Serious Wound<# should they refuse or attempt to go against your order, but this loosens your grip over them by 1 Power. If they fulfill your order, all your remaining Power over them is removed.

partialSuccess.result: You hold 1 Power over them. For as long as you retain Power over them, they take 1 #>text-keyword>Serious Wound<# should they refuse or attempt to go against your order, but this loosens your grip over them by 1 Power. If they fulfill your order, all your remaining Power over them is removed.

failure.result: Something goes wrong, such as they get hurt in the process or the order's outcome is different than what you imagined. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: You know how to implant orders into the minds of your "subjects".

options.name: Options
items: Enticement: Entice an entity to come to you.
Visions: #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='See Through the Illusion':data-action='open'>See Through the Illusion<# into a specific place of your choice.
Inspiration: Ask the GM if there is anything strange or supernatural about the situation you're in. The answer will be revealed through your art.

rules.trigger: Whenever you dive deep into your art and allow yourself to be inspired by the Truth,

completeSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below.

failure.result: You have gazed too deeply into the abyss. Choose one option from the list below, but you also experience terrifying visions or encounter something horrible. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

options.name: Options
items: Durable: The construction can be used multiple times and doesn't break easily.
Effective: The construction confers #>text-posmod>+1<# on rolls where it is used for its intended purpose.
Lethal: The construction causes #>text-keyword>+1 Harm<#.
Protective: The construction confers #>text-posmod>+1<# armor.

rules.trigger: Whenever you are about to create or repair something,
rules.outro: explain what you are about to do. The GM will tell you what you need to succeed, and once you have collected these materials, you may %insert.rollPrompt%.

completeSuccess.result: The construction is successful and you may pick two options from below.

partialSuccess.result: The construction has minor flaws. You may choose one option from the list below from below.

failure.result: You complete the construction or repair, but it has significant flaws, some of which are hidden. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.trigger: Whenever you truly desire something,
rules.outro: you may take #>text-posmod>+2<# to a roll by losing #>text-negmod>−2<# #>text-keyword>Stability<#.

options.name: Options
items: Escape bindings or restraints.
Get past an obstacle (creature or object).
Get into or make it through a space you normally wouldn't be able to.

rules.trigger: Whenever you perform acrobatic or agile feats,

completeSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below, but you expose yourself to danger or incur a cost.

failure.result: Choose one option from the list below, but something goes very wrong. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: #>text-center>Your body and mind are as one.<#

options.name: Options
items: They become suspicious of someone else of your choosing.
They view you as their ally, for as long as you don't betray them (#>text-posmod>+1<# to all rolls against them).
They willingly do a favor for you.

rules.trigger: Whenever you manipulate an NPC in a longer conversation,

completeSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below. You may save one until later during this scene.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below.

failure.result: They're on to you. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.trigger: When you focus your senses at a location where the Illusion is weak,

completeSuccess.result: You can discern clear details regarding the location, and may be able to speak to entities tied to it.

partialSuccess.result: You get some basic impressions regarding the location.

failure.result: The Illusion tears. The veil is lifted temporarily, revealing an alternate dimension—the GM determines which one. The PC could be sucked into it or something may cross over into our reality. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

edges.name: Edges
items: #>text-edgename>On a Swivel<# — Discover a threat before it discovers you.
#>text-edgename>Not Today<# — Avoid an attack.
#>text-edgename>Sucker Punch<# — Get the jump on them: Harm your opponent before they can react.

rules.trigger: Whenever you're entering a dangerous situation,

completeSuccess.result: Gain 3 Edges. You may spend them anytime during the scene.

partialSuccess.result: Gain 2 Edges. You may spend them anytime during the scene.

failure.result: Gain 1 Edge, but you are in over your head. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

edges.name: Edges
items: #>text-edgename>Easy Dodge<# — Avoid an attack.
#>text-edgename>Opportunity Calls<# — Manage to snatch something.
#>text-edgename>Patience, Patience<# — Maneuver into a better position.
#>text-edgename>Clever Trick<# — Put someone in a bad position (everyone gets #>text-posmod>+2<# to any attack Moves).

rules.trigger: Whenever you are in a violent conflict,

completeSuccess.result: Gain 3 Edges. You may spend them any time during the scene.

partialSuccess.result: Gain 2 Edges. You may spend them any time during the scene.

failure.result: Gain 1 Edge, but you attract attention from the hostiles. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: You keep your calm and cool, even in the midst of violence and chaos.

gmoptions.name: GM Options
items: You do not have working protection against the forces or entities the ritual summons.
The effects of the ritual are slightly different than what you had imagined.
The ritual summons unexpected entities or forces.

rules.trigger: Whenever you attempt to perform a magical ritual from a set of instructions,

completeSuccess.result: You perform every step correctly; the ritual works as intended.

partialSuccess.result: You make a minor error. The GM chooses one: %list.gmoptions%

failure.result: You misunderstand the scripture and perform the ritual with no control whatsoever over the resulting outcome. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: You know a little of magical rituals, but have never gone beyond performing written instructions.

options.name: Options
items: See the true form of a creature or location.
Disperse magic targeting you.
Call on the entity.

rules.trigger: At the start of each game session,

completeSuccess.result: You may choose three options from the list below at any time during the session.

partialSuccess.result: You may choose one option from the list below at any time during the session.

failure.result: You may choose one option from the list below at any time during the session, but #>text-gmtext>the GM makes a Move<# for the entity at some point during the session.

rules.intro: You are bound to an extradimensional entity whose powers you can draw upon. Explain what you think it is when you take this Advantage.

options.name: Options
items: Make the animal go against its instincts.
Make the animal follow you.
Make the animal protect you against an attacker.

rules.trigger: Whenever you attempt to control an animal,

completeSuccess.result: Choose three options from the list below. You may save up to two for later.

partialSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below. You may save one for later.

failure.result: Choose one option from the list below, but the animal is affected by your memories and Disadvantages. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: #>text-center>You are able to understand and control animals.<#

options.name: Options
items: Scale a seemingly impossible obstacle.
Make a seemingly life-threatening leap without suffering #>text-keyword>Harm<#.
Successfully avoid a threat.

rules.trigger: Whenever you execute acrobatic maneuvers,

completeSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below. You may save one until later.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below.

failure.result: Choose one option from the list below, but a complication, cost, or new threat emerges. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: You are deft at running and jumping, even over difficult terrain.

questions.name: Questions
items: What sort of person are you?
Is there anything odd about you?

rules.intro: Whenever you #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Read a Person':data-action='open'>Read a Person<#, you may choose from these questions in addition to the usual ones: %list.questions%

expertise.name: Fields of Expertise
items: Archeology
Economics
History
Comparative Literature
Psychology
Sociology
Theology
(Other)

rules.intro: You are an expert in certain fields of knowledge. Choose two areas of expertise when you gain this Advantage: %list.expertise%
rules.outro: Whenever you #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Investigate':data-action='open'>Investigate<# something associated with one of your chosen fields, you always get to ask one additional question, regardless of the outcome, and may ask any questions you want.

rules.intro: Whenever you #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Read a Person':data-action='open'>Read a Person<# and mention a name, person, or object, you may always ask "Are you lying?"%insert.break%This doesn't count towards the number of questions you're allowed to normally ask.

rules.trigger: Whenever you learn new information about alternate planes of existence, a supernatural entity, or a Higher Power,
Whenever you are dealt a #>text-keyword>Critical Wound<#,
rules.outro: you may mark 1 Time from Condemned to immediately stabilize the #>text-keyword>Wound<#.

rules.trigger: Whenever you die,
rules.outro: mark 2 Time from Condemned and reawaken, injured and weak, but alive, and with all of your #>text-keyword>Wounds<# stabilized.

options.name: Options
items: Remember something that's advantageous in a negotiation. Ask the GM what it is.
You possess some equipment you can use to get out of a sticky situation. Ask the GM what it is.
You have special field training that would be useful in getting past one of your obstacles. Ask the GM what it is.

rules.trigger: Whenever you commence a dangerous mission,

completeSuccess.result: Choose three options from the list below, at any time during the mission.

partialSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below, at any time during the mission.

failure.result: At any time during the mission, choose one option from the list below, but you've failed to account for something. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

options.name: Options
items: Nobody is harmed during the ritual.
The entity will not reappear later.
The entity will not become hostile toward you.

rules.trigger: Whenever you perform an exorcism to banish a spirit or extradimensional creature,
rules.outro: explain what the ritual looks like and %insert.rollPrompt%.

completeSuccess.result: The creature is banished. Choose two options from the list below.

partialSuccess.result: The creature is banished. Choose one option from the list below.

failure.result: The creature resists banishment and something goes terribly wrong, such as the creature possessing you. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

options.name: Options
items: Ask the GM one question about this place.
You have a contact at this place who could help you, with a bit of convincing.
You have a hideout here, where you can put your head down and get some rest.
You know something about this place. Tell the others what.

rules.trigger: Whenever you are heading out to a community or another part of the city,

completeSuccess.result: You have been here before. Choose two options from the list below any time during your visit.

partialSuccess.result: You have heard of this place. Choose one option from the list below any time during your visit.

failure.result: You have been here before, but something bad happened. Choose one option from the list below any time during your visit. The GM explains what kind of problem awaits you here. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: You take #>text-keyword>+1 ongoing<# to all #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Endure Injury':data-action='open'>Endure Injury<# rolls.

complications.name: Complications
items: Someone discovers the intrusion. You must take risks or compromise on how much you're able to accomplish.
You leave traces of your intrusion.

rules.trigger: Whenever you penetrate digital networks in the pursuit of confidential data, crack software, or disable security systems,

completeSuccess.result: You accomplish your task without a problem.

partialSuccess.result: Complications arise. Choose one option: %list.complications%

failure.result: Unbeknownst to you, your intrusion didn't work out as you wanted. Maybe you didn't succeed at your task as well as you imagined, or you may have been discovered by personal enemies, law enforcement, or something else lurking in the network. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

options.name: Options
items: They are attracted to you.
They forget their woes when experiencing your art.
They are totally captivated by your art and forget all about their surrounding environment.

gmoptions.name: GM Options
items: They become obsessed with you.
They want you right now.

rules.trigger: Whenever you use your art to seduce an NPC,

completeSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below, but the GM also chooses one of the following: %list.gmoptions%

failure.result: They are affected by you in a way you didn't anticipate, or the attraction is uncomfortably strong—you choose. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

gmoptions.name: GM Options
items: Someone got into trouble.
The job isn't done, and needs something else to be completed.
There will be repercussions later on.

rules.trigger: Whenever you send your henchmen to do a risky job,

completeSuccess.result: They follow your orders and everything goes according to plan.

partialSuccess.result: They follow your orders, but GM picks one option: %list.gmoptions%

failure.result: The GM decides what went wrong, and whether it's immediately evident or will become apparent later on. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: You have five to ten criminal henchmen who are loyal to you, usually for as long as you continue paying them.

options.name: Options
items: Prevent the NPC from noticing something in her immediate vicinity.
Get the NPC to disclose something important (the GM will provide the details).
Distract the NPC. You take #>text-posmod>+1<# to your next roll against them.

rules.trigger: Whenever you talk to an NPC to get their attention,

completeSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below.

failure.result: Choose one option from the list below, but they grow suspicious of your motives. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

questions.name: Questions
items: Who here has information I want?
Where can I find what I am looking for?
Who is watching me?
Is there anything else of interest?

rules.trigger: Whenever you move through a small crowd to gather information,
rules.outro: %insert.rollPrompt%.%insert.break%Examples of a 'small crowd' include a party, bar/restaurant, or an office.%insert.break%You decide what specific information you are looking for, as long as it makes sense for the crowd to possess such information.

completeSuccess.result: Ask three questions from the list below.

partialSuccess.result: Ask two questions from the list below, but you also draw unwanted attention to yourself.

failure.result: Ask one question from the list below, but you've blown your cover. Those who have what you're looking for will be expecting you. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.trigger: Whenever you create something or carry out an experiment,

edges.name: Edges
items: #>text-edgename>Refuse to Give Up<# — Postpone the effects of a critical injury until you have made it out of the threat's reach.
#>text-edgename>Will Over Skill<# — Roll #>text-rolltrait>+Willpower<# instead of the normal attribute whenever you avoid or fight whatever is threatening you.
#>text-edgename>Steel Yourself<# — Break free from a supernatural effect.

rules.trigger: Whenever you push yourself to the limit to overcome a threat,

completeSuccess.result: Gain 3 Edges. You may spend them any time during the scene.

partialSuccess.result: Gain 2 Edges. You may spend them any time during the scene.

failure.result: Gain 1 Edge, but you push yourself past your breaking point. Decrease #>text-negmod>−2<# #>text-keyword>Stability<#.

gmoptions.name: GM Options
items: You're subjected to a counterattack.
You do less damage than intended.
You lose something important.
You expend all your ammo.
You're beset by a new threat.
You'll be in trouble later on.

rules.trigger: When you engage an able opponent within arm's reach in close combat, including immediately after a successful parry,

completeSuccess.result: You inflict #>text-keyword>3 Harm<# to your opponent(s) and avoid counterattacks.

partialSuccess.result: You inflict #>text-keyword>3 Harm<#, but at a cost. The GM chooses one: %list.gmoptions%

failure.result: Your attack doesn't go as anticipated. You might be subjected to bad luck, miss your target, or pay a high price for your assault. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: #>text-center>You've competed professionally in fencing.<#%insert.break%You own a rapier at home and you know how to wield it. Add the following to the attacks available to you when fighting with a sword: %list.inline-attacks%

questions.name: Questions
items: Where are you from?
Are you capable of violence?
How could I seduce or tempt you?
Why are you here?
What are you working on?

rules.trigger: Whenever you have had time to study somebody for a while,

completeSuccess.result: Ask three questions from the list below.

partialSuccess.result: Ask two questions from the list below.

failure.result: Ask one question from the list below, but you expose your inquisitiveness to the person you're observing. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.trigger: Whenever you need to escape a dangerous situation,

completeSuccess.result: You escape without complications.

partialSuccess.result: You can choose to stay or escape at a cost, such as leaving something important behind or take something traceable with you. The GM decides what it is.

failure.result: You are only half out the door when you're caught in a really bad spot. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: #>text-center>You are a master at slipping away when the shit hits the fan.<#

options.name: Options
items: The person must have you, and will abandon their normally reasonable behavior to do so.
The person is distracted by you for as long as you're in the vicinity, unable to concentrate on anything else.
The person becomes jealous of anyone competing for your attention, and tries to dispose of them by any means necessary.
You make them uncertain and confused. You take #>text-keyword>+1 ongoing<# against them during this scene.

rules.trigger: Whenever you make moves to attract an NPC to you,

completeSuccess.result: Choose three options from the list below any time during this scene.

partialSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below any time during this scene.

failure.result: Choose one option from the list below any time during this scene, but the nature of the attraction is different than you had hoped. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.trigger: Whenever you lay your hands on a seriously or critically wounded person and pray,

completeSuccess.result: You fully heal the injured person, channeling the #>text-keyword>Wound<# onto yourself or a selected target.

partialSuccess.result: You stabilize the injured, channeling the #>text-keyword>Wound<# onto yourself or a selected target.

failure.result: You may choose to stabilize the injured, but if you do, the powers break free from your control.

rules.intro: You are able to heal others' #>text-keyword>Wounds<# without using medicine or first aid, but you must channel the injuries onto yourself or another living victim.%insert.break%To transfer a #>text-keyword>Wound<#, you must be able to see the victim, but not touch them and they are not required to consent.%insert.break%The #>text-keyword>Wound<# transferred is of the same type, severity, and condition as the original.

options.name: Options
items: Find a secure hiding spot for a while.
Find an alternate route to avoid encountering people.
Bypass a security system or other obstacle without being noticed.

rules.trigger: Whenever you keep hidden and try to avoid drawing attention to yourself,

completeSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below. You may spend them any time during the scene.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below. You may spend them any time during the scene.

failure.result: Choose one option from the list below, but you manage to attract someone's attention. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

options.name: Options
items: Viciousness — #>text-keyword>+1 ongoing<# to #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Engage in Combat':data-action='open'>Engage in Combat<# rolls for the remainder of the fight.
Adrenaline Rush — #>text-keyword>+1 ongoing<# to #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Endure Injury':data-action='open'>Endure Injury<# rolls for the remainder of the fight.

rules.trigger: Whenever you suffer a serious or critical injury yet refuse to yield,
rules.outro: %insert.rollPrompt%.%insert.break%On a success, you may temporarily ignore the effects of the injuries, but you will need treatment to stabilize them as soon as the time limit expires.

completeSuccess.result: You ignore your injuries until the conflict is over, and you may choose one option from the list below: %list.options%

partialSuccess.result: You ignore your injuries until the conflict is over.

failure.result: You overexert yourself and after a few moments your injuries cause you to pass out and collapse. After your next action, the GM decides when and how you pass out.

rules.trigger: Whenever you travel between two places in the city and allow your madness to guide you through the alleys,

completeSuccess.result: You discover a shortcut through the alleys, which takes you to your destination within a few minutes, regardless of how far the distance actually is.

partialSuccess.result: You discover a shortcut, but there is also some sort of obstacle you will need to get past.

failure.result: You discover a shortcut, but it leads you into a dangerous situation, such as the lair of some creature or an ambush set by some gang. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

completeSuccess.result: Your friends can arrange for what you want.

failure.result: They arrange for what you want, but you get on a powerful person's bad side or attract negative publicity. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: #>text-center>You have friends with power and influence.<#

options.name: Options
items: Learn something about a creature's true nature.
Learn if something has a magical nature.
Learn where the Illusion is weakest towards other dimensions.

rules.trigger: Whenever you utilize your magical intuition,

completeSuccess.result: Choose three options from the list below. Up to two may be saved until later this scene.

partialSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below. One may be saved until later this scene.

failure.result: Choose one option from the list below, but you also get an unexpected vision or attract attention. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: You have an innate ability to perceive Kirlian auras and sense the presence of magic.

You can sense people's motives through subconscious readings of their body language, word choices, and behavior.%insert.break%Whenever you #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Read a Person':data-action='open'>Read a Person<#, you may always ask one additional question, regardless of the outcome of your roll.

gmoptions.name: GM Options
items: You're subjected to a counterattack.
You do less damage than intended.
You lose something important.
You expend all your ammo.
You're beset by a new threat.
You'll be in trouble later on.

subItems.name: Two In the Chest, One in the Head

rules.trigger: When you engage an able opponent out of your reach but no farther than a few meters away in ranged combat,

completeSuccess.result: You inflict #>text-keyword>4 Harm<# to your opponent(s) and avoid counterattacks.

partialSuccess.result: You inflict #>text-keyword>4 Harm<#, but at a cost. The GM chooses one:

failure.result: Your attack doesn't go as anticipated. You might be subjected to bad luck, miss your target, or pay a high price for your assault. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.trigger: When you engage an able opponent out of your reach but no farther than a few meters away in ranged combat,
rules.outro: expend 1 Ammo and %insert.rollPrompt%. A targeted PC must #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Act Under Pressure':data-action='open'>Act Under Pressure<#.

completeSuccess.result: You inflict #>text-keyword>1 Harm<# to your opponent(s) and avoid counterattacks.

partialSuccess.result: You inflict #>text-keyword>1 Harm<#, but at a cost. The GM chooses one:

failure.result: Your attack doesn't go as anticipated. You might be subjected to bad luck, miss your target, or pay a high price for your assault. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: #>text-center>You are a master of gunplay.<#%insert.break%When you #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Engage in Combat':data-action='open'>Engage in Combat<# with a firearm, roll #>text-rolltrait>+Coolness<# instead of #>text-rolltrait>+Violence<#, and add the following to your available attacks: %list.inline-attacks%

rules.trigger: Whenever you want to meet someone or find out the truth about something in the Dream,

completeSuccess.result: You meet the intended person or arrive at the specific place in the Dream.

partialSuccess.result: You meet the intended person, or arrive at the specific place. However, some element has changed, or something followed you or the person in question.

failure.result: You are lost in the Dream and cannot wake up until you find your way back.

rules.intro: #>text-center>You are a talented, self-taught dream wanderer.<#

rules.trigger: Whenever you fight your deity's enemies or fight to protect a sacred object,
rules.outro: you do #>text-keyword>+1 Harm<# and take #>text-keyword>+1 ongoing<# to #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Endure Injury':data-action='open'>Endure Injury<#.%insert.break%#>text-trigger>If you lose such a battle,<# your deity becomes irate: You take #>text-negmod>−1<# #>text-keyword>ongoing<# to all actions related to your deity until you have atoned for your failure.

rules.intro: Whenever you #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Observe a Situation':data-action='open'>Observe a Situation<# and act on the GM's answers, take #>text-posmod>+2<# instead of #>text-posmod>+1<#.
effectFunctions: AddNote:#>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Observe a Situation':data-action='open'>Observe a Situation<#/completeSuccess,Take #>text-posmod>+2<# instead of #>text-posmod>+1<# for acting on the GM's answers.

AddNote:#>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Observe a Situation':data-action='open'>Observe a Situation<#/partialSuccess,Take #>text-posmod>+2<# instead of #>text-posmod>+1<# for acting on the GM's answers.

questions.name: Questions
items: Are you hiding anything from me?
How do you really feel about me?

rules.intro: Whenever you #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Read a Person':data-action='open'>Read a Person<#, you may choose from these questions in addition to the usual ones: %list.questions%

questions.name: Questions
items: What properties does this have? (take #>text-posmod>+1<# to any rolls against entities or objects of a similar type next time you encounter it).
How do I make use of this? (take #>text-posmod>+1<# to any rolls associated with using the object).
What is its purpose?

rules.intro: Whenever you #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Investigate':data-action='open'>Investigate<# an object or entity using the proper equipment, you may choose from these following questions, in addition to those acquired through investigation: %list.questions%

questions.name: Questions
items: What was the chain of events?
What can I assume about the perpetrator?
Which mistakes did the perpetrator make?
When was the crime committed?
When was someone here last?
Does the crime remind me of something I am familiar with already and, if so, what?
Who might know more about the crime?

rules.trigger: Whenever you investigate a crime scene,

completeSuccess.result: Ask two questions from the list below.

partialSuccess.result: Ask one question from the list below.

failure.result: Ask one question from the list below, but your investigation leads you into danger or introduces additional problems later on.

options.name: Options
items: People forget what they're doing and can do nothing but stare at you.
Draw someone to you.
Get someone to do what you ask.

rules.trigger: Whenever you attract everyone's attention,

completeSuccess.result: Choose three options from the list below. You may save up to two until later in the scene.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below.

failure.result: Choose one option from the list below, but someone present becomes obsessed, wanting to have you, keep you, and own you for themselves. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: #>text-center>You are a seasoned marksman.<# #>text-center>You deal #>text-keyword>+1 Harm<# with firearms.<#

edges.name: Edges
items: #>text-edgename>Block<# — Avoid a melee attack.

#>text-edgename>Roundhouse Strike<# — #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Engage in Combat':data-action='open'>Engage in Combat<# against several opponents surrounding you, counting as a single attack.
#>text-edgename>Disarm<# — Remove an opponent's weapon.
#>text-edgename>Throw<# — Reposition an opponent or drop them to the ground.

rules.trigger: Whenever you're fighting in close quarters,

completeSuccess.result: Gain 2 Edges. You may spend them any time during the scene.

partialSuccess.result: Gain 1 Edge.

failure.result: Gain 1 Edge, but you underestimate your opponents, who may be more numerous or skilled than you first assumed. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

options.name: Options
items: Catch a stranger's attention. They become curious and approach you.
Change a person's disposition towards you from either aggressive to suspicious, suspicious to neutral, or neutral to positive.
Make opponents perceive you as harmless and ignore you for as long as you remain in the background and do not act against them.

rules.trigger: Whenever your aura is truly noticeable,

completeSuccess.result: Choose two separate options.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below.

failure.result: Choose one option from the list below, but you also attract unwanted attention. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: You radiate an aura that makes people trust you and seek your company.

edges.name: Edges
items: #>text-edgename>Dodge<# — Avoid an attack.

#>text-edgename>Blinding Speed<# — #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Engage in Combat':data-action='open'>Engage in Combat<# with every opponent within reach of your weapon as a single attack. If you're attacking with a firearm, this uses up all its ammo.
#>text-edgename>Uncanny Precision<# — Hit your opponent's weak spot. Deal #>text-keyword>+1 Harm<#.

rules.trigger: Whenever you move unexpectedly fast in combat,

completeSuccess.result: Gain 3 Edges. You may spend them any time during the scene.

partialSuccess.result: Gain 2 Edges. You may spend them any time during the scene.

failure.result: Gain 1 Edge, but you also end up in a bad spot or face unexpected resistance. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

options.name: Options
items: They want to see more of your art.
They are affected by the emotion you wanted to convey (e.g., anger, sorrow, fear, joy, lust, etc).
They look up to you (take #>text-keyword>+1 ongoing<# with the audience during this scene).
Their attention is fixed entirely on you throughout your performance.

rules.trigger: Whenever you perform your chosen art form or show your works to an audience,
rules.outro: %insert.rollPrompt% to influence your audience at any time during the scene.

completeSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below any time during the scene.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below any time during the scene.

failure.result: Choose one option from the list below, but a complication/threat manifests. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: Whenever you #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Keep It Together':data-action='open'>Keep It Together<# and the result is a #>text-resultlabel>(9—14)<#, you may suppress your emotions and postpone their effects until the next scene.
effectFunctions: AddNote:#>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Keep It Together':data-action='open'>Keep It Together<#:partialSuccess='You may suppress your emotions, postponing their effects until the next scene.'

rules.intro: You've competed professionally in a contact sport (e.g. ice hockey, football), through which you have learned to take a hit.%insert.break%You take #>text-keyword>+1 ongoing<# to #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Endure Injury':data-action='open'>Endure Injury<# rolls against close-combat attacks.

rules.trigger: Whenever you venture into alternate planes of existence or meet entities from other dimensions,
rules.outro: you may declare that you have read about this dimension or creature before. Ask the GM what you learned from your past studies.

options.name: Options
items: Aim for the sensitive parts: Deal #>text-keyword>+1 Harm<#.

Knock out: The NPC is rendered unconcious. PCs roll to #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Endure Injury':data-action='open'>Endure Injury<# and become neutralized on a #>text-resultlabel>(—9)<#.
Careful: You act soundlessly and, if your victim dies, you leave no clues or traces behind.

rules.trigger: Whenever you attack someone who's unprepared for it,

completeSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below.

failure.result: You expose your betrayal and your target gets to react to your attack as usual. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

options.name: Options
items: You discover a portal to another dimension, and a path you can trace back to it later.
You make contact with someone—or something—who can help you, for the right price.
You find something valuable or important, in addition to what you were looking for. The GM will tell you what it is.

rules.trigger: Whenever you search the Dark Net for forbidden information, rare items, or myths,

completeSuccess.result: You discover what you're looking for, and may also choose one option: %list.options%

partialSuccess.result: You find what you're looking for, but you're also exposed to repulsive and frightening stimuli. You must #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Keep It Together':data-action='open'>Keep It Together<# to see how it affects you.

failure.result: You find what you're after, but also contact something very dangerous. It might attempt to latch onto you or follow you back into reality. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.trigger: Whenever you're building an improvised bomb under time pressure,

completeSuccess.result: You construct a functional bomb.

partialSuccess.result: The bomb's blast potential is lower than usual (decrease #>text-keyword>Harm<# dealt by #>text-negmod>−1<#).

failure.result: The bomb is unpredictable. Maybe it doesn't detonate, detonates prematurely, or it is more powerful and volatile than expected. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.trigger: When you are disarming a bomb,

completeSuccess.result: The bomb is deactivated.

partialSuccess.result: Complications arise. Maybe you can't completely turn it off, just delay the timer, weaken the explosive effect, or something else turns up and makes thing worse.

failure.result: Fuck, that's not good! The bomb may go off in your hands, the timer starts counting down from 10, 9, 8, 7…, or even bigger problems occur. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.intro: You can build and disarm bombs. If you have enough time and resources, you can build any kind of bomb you like without a roll.

options.name: Options
items: Make someone want to take care of you.
Make an aggressive person want to not harm you.
Make someone confide in you.

rules.trigger: Whenever you appear defenseless during a dangerous experience,

completeSuccess.result: Choose three options from the list below. You may save up to two options for use later during the scene.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below.

failure.result: Someone tries to take advantage of you and your position. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

rules.trigger: Whenever you sacrifice someone else to further your own goals,
When someone directly or indirectly ruins your plans,
rules.outro: you take #>text-keyword>+1 ongoing<# against them until you have taken revenge or received restitution of equal worth to what you lost.

rules.intro: #>text-center>You are not as easily affected by trauma as others.<#%insert.break%Whenever you would lose #>text-keyword>Stability<#, lose one fewer level than normal.

edges.name: Edges
items: #>text-edgename>Brutal Assault<# — Take #>text-keyword>+1 Harm<# to your attack.
#>text-edgename>What Pain?<# — Take #>text-posmod>+2<# to #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Endure Injury':data-action='open'>Endure Injury<#.
#>text-edgename>See Only Red<# — Shake off and ignore psychological or supernatural influence.

rules.trigger: When you choose to awaken your inner rage in combat,
rules.outro: lose #>text-negmod>−1<# #>text-keyword>Stability<# and mark 1 Rage.%insert.break%Every time you get a wound and every time you defeat a foe, increase Rage (#>text-posmod>+1<#).%insert.break%Rage lasts until the end of the combat.%insert.break%During combat, you may spend 1 Rage to activate 1 Edge from the list below:

options.name: Options
items: They offer you something they think you'd rather have.
Retreat from the scene.
They are terrorized; you have #>text-keyword>+1 ongoing<# on all rolls against them until they've proven they're not afraid of you.

They attack you from a disadvantaged position. You take #>text-posmod>+2<# on your roll to #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Engage in Combat':data-action='open'>Engage in Combat<# if you counterattack.

rules.trigger: Whenever you credibly threaten someone directly or suggestively,

completeSuccess.result: They must decide to either do what you want or defy you with the knowledge that you can execute your threat.

partialSuccess.result: You must give them a third option. Choose one: %list.options%

failure.result: Turns out you didn't have the advantage you thought you did. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

options.name: Options
items: Attract other people to join in the crowd.
Have crowd members give you all their valuables.
Unite the crowd to fight for you.
Incite the crowd into an orgy of unbridled emotion: sexual lust, anger, sorrow, violence, generosity, or celebrating, depending on what concepts you are instilling into them.
Have the crowd disperse and calmly return to their normal lives.

rules.trigger: Whenever you manipulate a crowd,

completeSuccess.result: Choose three options from the list below, useable any time during this scene.

partialSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below, useable any time during this scene.

failure.result: Choose one option from the list below, useable any time during this scene. However, the crowd becomes uncontrollable and volatile, and cannot be dispersed. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

options.name: Options
items: Give you something you want.
Reveal a secret.
Fight to protect you. NPCs who fall in love with you cannot oppose you, as long as you haven't expended all your options. Against PCs, you may only choose the following options:
Make them feel bad for opposing you (they must #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Keep It Together':data-action='open'>Keep It Together<#)
They feel happy in your presence, and gain #>text-posmod>+2<# #>text-keyword>Stability<#.

rules.trigger: Whenever you have an intimate moment with someone,

completeSuccess.result: Choose three options from the list below, useable any time in the story.

partialSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below, useable any time in the story.

failure.result: Choose one option from the list below, useable any time in the story, but you also develop feelings for the person. Increase your #>text-keyword>Relation<# to them by #>text-posmod>+1<#.

rules.intro: #>text-center>You can consciously make people fall in love with you.<#

rules.trigger: Whenever you encounter someone who has likely heard about you,

completeSuccess.result: They know of your reputation; you can decide what they have heard. The GM will have them act accordingly. You take #>text-posmod>+2<# to your next roll to #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Influence Other NPC':data-action='open'>Influence<# them.

partialSuccess.result: They know of your reputation; you can decide what they have heard.

failure.result: They know of your reputation; the GM decides what they have heard.

rules.intro: #>text-center>You are famous in your trade.<#

options.name: Options
items: Prepare Ambush - Deal your weapon's #>text-keyword>Harm<# when your enemy stumbles in.
Camouflage - Take #>text-keyword>+2 ongoing<# to #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Act Under Pressure':data-action='open'>Act Under Pressure<# for as long as you remain hiding.
Move in Shadows - Take #>text-keyword>+2 ongoing<# to #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Avoid Harm':data-action='open'>Avoid Harm<# from ranged weapons.

rules.trigger: Whenever you are hunting someone or something,

completeSuccess.result: Choose three options from the list below. You may spend them anytime during this scene.

partialSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below. You may spend them anytime during this scene.

failure.result: Choose one option from the list below, but you become the prey. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

options.name: Options
items: Afflict your victim with a temporary psychosis, in which they are haunted by their fears (NPCs only).
Trigger a Disadvantage within another person (PCs only, roll for the Disadvantage).
Affect an additional victim.
Call for creatures of madness to haunt the infected.

rules.trigger: Whenever you allow your madness to infect someone you're speaking with,

completeSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below.

failure.result: Your intended victim's own terrors and Dark Secrets manifest within you, instead. You must #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Keep It Together':data-action='open'>Keep It Together<#.

rules.trigger: Whenever you're trying to frighten another person,

completeSuccess.result: They succumb to fear and give in to your demands.

partialSuccess.result: They run away from you or give in to you, GM's choice.

failure.result: They see you as their primary threat and act accordingly. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<# for them.

rules.intro: There is something about you that instinctively makes others fear you.

edges.name: Edges
items: #>text-edgename>Meat Shield<# — Force them to take all the #>text-keyword>Harm<# from one attack for you.
#>text-edgename>Nothing But Bait<# — Expose someone to danger so you can flank an enemy (deal #>text-keyword>+1 Harm<#).
#>text-edgename>Leave Them Behind<# — Abandon them to the enemy while you slip away.

rules.trigger: Whenever you sacrifice another to save your own skin,

completeSuccess.result: Gain 3 Edges. You may spend them any time during the scene.

partialSuccess.result: Gain 2 Edges.

failure.result: Things turns out in a bad way for you instead. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.

options.name: Options
items: Lie - Come up with a convincing lie.
Gear Up - Find something you can use as a makeshift melee weapon. The GM will tell you what it is.
Hide - Stay out of a pursuer's sight.

Prepare - Set a trap that gives you a #>text-posmod>+2<# surprise bonus the first time you #>item-button text-movename:data-item-name='Engage in Combat':data-action='open'>Engage in Combat<# after the trap is sprung.

rules.trigger: Whenever you attempt to get out of a dangerous situation by winging it,

completeSuccess.result: Choose two options from the list below.

partialSuccess.result: Choose one option from the list below.

failure.result: Your improvisation makes the situation worse. #>text-gmtext>The GM makes a Move<#.
